intro: Cyphia phyteuma, commonly known as the waxflower or the silver bush, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, white to pinkish flowers. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its compact growth habit and long-lasting blooms. Cyphia phyteuma thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its botanical features make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant and low-maintenance plants.
